document.heading: Criminal and Juvenile Justice Reform Amendment Act of 1992

history.narrative: Law 9-272, the “Criminal and Juvenile Justice Reform Amendment Act of 1992,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 9-374, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 1, 1972, and December 15, 1972, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 14, 1993, it was assigned Act No. 9-401 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 9-272 became effective on May 15, 1993.
